Table of Contents

Class CreatureTemplate

Namespace
ECCLibrary.Data
Assembly
ECCLibrary.dll

This class contains all settings related to the registering and automatic prefab initialization of creatures by the library.

public sealed class CreatureTemplate
Inheritance
object
CreatureTemplate
Inherited Members
object.ToString()

object.GetType()

Constructors

CreatureTemplate(TechType, BehaviourType, EcoTargetType, float)

Creates a new basic creature template instance based on an existing prefab. Beyond the constructor, this instance also contains several properties that can be modified.

public CreatureTemplate(TechType techTypeToClone, BehaviourType behaviourType, EcoTargetType ecoTargetType, float maxHealth)

Parameters

techTypeToClone TechType

The tech type to clone and use for this template.

behaviourType BehaviourType

Goes hand in hand with the EcoTargetType. Please note the Player is a SHARK! Determines very few creature behaviours/interactions.

ecoTargetType EcoTargetType

Goes hand in hand with the BehaviourType. Determines many interactions with creatures, specifically how this creature is "located" or "targeted" by other creatures

maxHealth float

Maximum health of this creature.

CreatureTemplate(TechType, float)

Creates a new basic creature template instance based on an existing prefab. Beyond the constructor, this instance also contains several properties that can be modified.

public CreatureTemplate(TechType techTypeToClone, float maxHealth)

Parameters

techTypeToClone TechType

The tech type to clone and use for this template.

maxHealth float

Maximum health of this creature.

CreatureTemplate(GameObject, BehaviourType, EcoTargetType, float)

Creates a new basic creature template instance. Beyond the constructor, this instance also contains several properties that can be modified.

public CreatureTemplate(GameObject model, BehaviourType behaviourType, EcoTargetType ecoTargetType, float maxHealth)

Parameters

model GameObject

The model that is cloned to create the creature GameObject.

behaviourType BehaviourType

Goes hand in hand with the EcoTargetType. Please note the Player is a SHARK! Determines very few creature behaviours/interactions.

ecoTargetType EcoTargetType

Goes hand in hand with the BehaviourType. Determines many interactions with creatures, specifically how this creature is "located" or "targeted" by other creatures

maxHealth float

Maximum health of this creature.

Properties

AcidImmune

Whether the creature is immune to brine or not. False by default. Typically useful for Lost River creatures.

public bool AcidImmune { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

AggressiveToPilotingVehicleData

Contains data pertaining to the AggressiveToPilotingVehicle component, which encourages creatures to target any small vehicle that the player may be piloting (this includes ANY vehicle that inherits from the Vehicle component i.e. the Seamoth or Prawn Suit). Not many creatures use this component, but ones that do will be VERY aggressive (Boneshark levels of aggression!).

public AggressiveToPilotingVehicleData AggressiveToPilotingVehicleData { get; set; }

Property Value

AggressiveToPilotingVehicleData

AggressiveWhenSeeTargetList

A list of all data pertaining to the AggressiveWhenSeeTarget component, which enables the creature to become aggressive towards specific fauna/the player.

public List<AggressiveWhenSeeTargetData> AggressiveWhenSeeTargetList { get; set; }

Property Value

List<AggressiveWhenSeeTargetData>

AnimateByVelocityData

Contains data pertaining to the AnimateByVelocity component. This component sets animation parameters based on the creature's direction & velocity.
Means the 'speed' parameter can be used in the creature's Animator.
NOT assigned by default!

public AnimateByVelocityData AnimateByVelocityData { get; set; }

Property Value

AnimateByVelocityData

AttackCyclopsData

Contains data pertaining to creating the AttackCyclops CreatureAction. Not assigned by default.

public AttackCyclopsData AttackCyclopsData { get; set; }

Property Value

AttackCyclopsData

AttackLastTargetData

Contains data pertaining to creating the AttackLastTarget CreatureAction. Not assigned by default.

public AttackLastTargetData AttackLastTargetData { get; set; }

Property Value

AttackLastTargetData

AvoidObstaclesData

Contains data pertaining to creating the AvoidObstacles CreatureAction. This component is used by most creatures (everything besides leviathans) to avoid objects and/or terrain. Not assigned by default.

public AvoidObstaclesData AvoidObstaclesData { get; set; }

Property Value

AvoidObstaclesData

AvoidTerrainData

Contains data pertaining to creating the AvoidTerrain CreatureAction. This is a more advanced and expensive collision avoidance system used by leviathans.

public AvoidTerrainData AvoidTerrainData { get; set; }

Property Value

AvoidTerrainData

BehaviourLODData

Determines the distance for which certain calculations (such as Trail Managers) perform (or don't). It is recommended to increase these values for large creatures.

public BehaviourLODData BehaviourLODData { get; set; }

Property Value

BehaviourLODData

BehaviourType

Goes hand in hand with the EcoTargetType. Please note the Player is a SHARK! Determines very few creature behaviours/interactions.

public BehaviourType BehaviourType { get; set; }

Property Value

BehaviourType

BioReactorCharge

Total power output of this creature. All ECC creatures can be put in the bioreactor as long as this value is greater than 0. Default value is 200.

public float BioReactorCharge { get; set; }

Property Value

float

CanBeInfected

Whether this creature can randomly spawn with Kharaa symptoms. True by default.

public bool CanBeInfected { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

CellLevel

Roughly determines how far this creature can be loaded in. Default value is LargeWorldEntity.CellLevel.Medium.

public LargeWorldEntity.CellLevel CellLevel { get; set; }

Property Value

CellLevel

CreatureComponentType

The Type of the main component that must inherit from Creature.

public Type CreatureComponentType { get; }

Property Value

Type

EcoTargetType

Goes hand in hand with the BehaviourType. Determines many interactions with creatures, specifically how this creature is "located" or "targeted" by other creatures.

public EcoTargetType EcoTargetType { get; set; }

Property Value

EcoTargetType

EdibleData

Contains data pertaining to the Eatable [sic] component. Not assigned by default.

public EdibleData EdibleData { get; set; }

Property Value

EdibleData

EyeFOV

The FOV is used for detecting things such as prey. SHOULD BE NEGATIVE! This value has an expected range of [-1, 0]. Is 0f by default. A value of -1 means a given object is ALWAYS in view.

public float EyeFOV { get; set; }

Property Value

float

FleeOnDamageData

Contains data pertaining to the FleeOnDamage action. Assigned by default with default values and a priority of 0.8f.

public FleeOnDamageData FleeOnDamageData { get; set; }

Property Value

FleeOnDamageData

FleeWhenScaredData

Contains data pertaining to the FleeWhenScared action. Not assigned by default.

public FleeWhenScaredData FleeWhenScaredData { get; set; }

Property Value

FleeWhenScaredData

ItemSoundsType

Pickup sounds of the item.

public ItemSoundsType ItemSoundsType { get; set; }

Property Value

ItemSoundsType

LiveMixinData

Controls health and damage-taking aspects of this creature.

public LiveMixinData LiveMixinData { get; set; }

Property Value

LiveMixinData

LocomotionData

Contains data pertaining to creating the Locomotion component.

public LocomotionData LocomotionData { get; set; }

Property Value

LocomotionData

Mass

Mass in kg. Ranges from about 1.8f to 4050f. Default is 15kg.

public float Mass { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Model

The model that is cloned to create the creature GameObject.

This object is NOT cached; for anything that isn't directly loaded from an asset bundle, it is recommended to use UnityEngine.Object.DontDestroyOnLoad(UnityEngine.Object). If you want to be even safer, add the SceneCleanerPreserve to your object.

public GameObject Model { get; set; }

Property Value

GameObject

PhysicMaterial

Physic material used for all colliders. If unassigned, will default to FrictionlessPhysicMaterial.

public PhysicMaterial PhysicMaterial { get; set; }

Property Value

PhysicMaterial

PickupableFishData

Contains data pertaining to picking up and/or holding fish in your hands. Not assigned by default.

public PickupableFishData PickupableFishData { get; set; }

Property Value

PickupableFishData

RespawnData

Contains data pertaining to the CreatureDeath component. Assigned by default to enable respawning. MUST be assigned!

public RespawnData RespawnData { get; set; }

Property Value

RespawnData

ScannerRoomScannable

If set to true, the Scanner Room can scan for this creature. False by default.

public bool ScannerRoomScannable { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

ScareableData

Contains data pertaining to the Scareable component. This component is what enables small fish to swim away from the player and potential predators. Not assigned by default.

public ScareableData ScareableData { get; set; }

Property Value

ScareableData

SizeDistribution

Possible sizes for this creature. Randomly picks a value in the range of 0 to 1. This value can not go above 1. Flat curve at 1 by default.

public AnimationCurve SizeDistribution { get; set; }

Property Value

AnimationCurve

StayAtLeashData

Contains data pertaining to the StayAtLeashPosition action. This component keeps creatures from wandering too far. Not assigned by default.

public StayAtLeashData StayAtLeashData { get; set; }

Property Value

StayAtLeashData

SurfaceType

The Surface Type applied to the main collider. Default is VFXSurfaceTypes.organic.

public VFXSurfaceTypes SurfaceType { get; set; }

Property Value

VFXSurfaceTypes

SwimBehaviourData

Contains data pertaining to creating the SwimBehaviour component.

public SwimBehaviourData SwimBehaviourData { get; set; }

Property Value

SwimBehaviourData

SwimInSchoolData

Contains data pertaining to adding the SwimInSchool CreatureAction.

Each schooling creature chooses a single "leader" larger than itself (and of the same TechType) to follow. Therefore, the SizeDistribution property should be defined for this action to function properly.

Not assigned by default.

public SwimInSchoolData SwimInSchoolData { get; set; }

Property Value

SwimInSchoolData

SwimRandomData

Contains data pertaining to the SwimRandom action. Assigned a generic value by default, but can be changed or set to null.

public SwimRandomData SwimRandomData { get; set; }

Property Value

SwimRandomData

TraitsData

Settings that determine basic attributes of the creature.

public CreatureTraitsData TraitsData { get; set; }

Property Value

CreatureTraitsData

WaterParkCreatureData

Settings for growth in Alien Containment. Not assigned by default.

public WaterParkCreatureData WaterParkCreatureData { get; }

Property Value

WaterParkCreatureData

Methods

AddAggressiveWhenSeeTargetData(AggressiveWhenSeeTargetData)

Adds a single type of aggression to this creature. This method can be called MULTIPLE TIMES to add multiple types of aggression! Not functional without the AttackLastTarget component.

public CreatureTemplate AddAggressiveWhenSeeTargetData(AggressiveWhenSeeTargetData data)

Parameters

data AggressiveWhenSeeTargetData

Returns

CreatureTemplate

SetCreatureComponentType<T>()

Sets the Type of the main component. Must inherit from Creature.

public CreatureTemplate SetCreatureComponentType<T>() where T : Creature

Returns

CreatureTemplate

Type Parameters

T

SetWaterParkCreatureData(WaterParkCreatureDataStruct)

Properly assigns values to the WaterParkCreatureData property, and creates a new instance of the ScriptableObject if null.

public CreatureTemplate SetWaterParkCreatureData(WaterParkCreatureDataStruct dataStruct)

Parameters

dataStruct WaterParkCreatureDataStruct

Returns

CreatureTemplate
